sentences: Ma pean seisma siin kuni sa tagasi tuled.
context: The Estonian verb 'seisa' is the 3rd person singular present form of the verb 'seisma', which means 'to stand'. It's used when someone or something is in a standing position, either physically waiting in place or metaphorically taking a stance on an issue. This verb can refer to both literal physical standing and figurative positioning on matters.
